title: Boat carrying migrants capsizes off Italy, killing at least 26
byline: A boat carrying nearly 100 migrants capsized Wednesday in international waters off the Italian island of Lampedusa, killing at least 26 people and leaving about a dozen missing, the Italian coast guard and U.N. agencies said.

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle and Matara districts, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: One person injured in shooting in Hanwella
byline: A shooting incident has been reported in the Thunnana area within the Hanwella police division last night (13), police stated.

title: Acting Director of Police Cultural Division arrested over bribery allegations
byline: The Acting Director of the Police Cultural Division, SSP Sathish Gamage has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) over several bribery allegations.

title: Priyantha Weerasooriya assumes duties as Sri Lanka’s 37th IGP
byline: Priyantha Weerasooriya (Attorney-at-Law) has assumed duties as the 37th Inspector General of Police of Sri Lanka a short while ago at Police Headquarters, Colombo 02.

title: European leaders tentatively hopeful after call with Trump ahead of Putin summit
byline: European leaders appeared cautiously optimistic after holding a virtual meeting with Donald Trump on Wednesday, two days before he meets his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin in Alaska to discuss ending the war in Ukraine.

title: Kush worth Rs. 40 mln seized in Peliyagoda
byline: The Central Crime Investigation Bureau (CCIB) in Colombo has seized a consignment of Kush cannabis, estimated to be worth around Rs. 40 million, which had been smuggled into the country from Thailand concealed in air conditioning equipment.

title: 10-hour water cut in several areas of Gampaha today
byline: A 10-hour water cut will be imposed in several areas of the Gampaha District today (14), the National Water Supply & Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced.

title: Gunshots fired into air in front of house in Muthuhenawatte
byline: Two masked individuals, who arrived on a motorcycle at around 10 p.m. last night (13), in front of a house in the Nadun Uyana area of Muthuhenawatte, have fired shots into the air before fleeing the scene.

title: WhatsApp says Russia is trying to block it
byline: WhatsApp said Russia was trying to block its services because the social media messaging app owned by Meta Platforms  offered people’s right to secure communication, and vowed to continue trying to make encrypted services available in Russia.

title: Large-scale renovations begin at Sri Lanka’s Parliament after 42 Years
byline: The large-scale renovations of the Parliament of Sri Lanka have now commenced, according to the Parliamentary Communications Department.

title: Unidentified body found floating in Mahaweli River
byline: An unidentified body has been found floating in the Mahaweli River in the Polgolla area, within the Kandy Police Division.

title: Dubai resident Nadeen Ayoub to represent Palestine at Miss Universe 2025
byline: Former Miss Earth finalist Nadeen Ayoub will represent Palestine at Miss Universe 2025. This will be the first time Palestine has been represented at the competition.

title: Politicians supporting underworld, drug traffickers identified – IGP
byline: Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya says that the politicians who supported drug traffickers and underworld activities have already been identified.

title: Sri Lanka and Oman discuss ways to improve bilateral cooperation in energy sector
byline: A meeting between Minister of Energy Kumara Jayakody and the Ambassador of Oman to Sri Lanka, Ahmed Ali Said Al Rashid, took place this afternoon (14) at the Ministry of Energy premises.

title: UN Rights Chief urges Govt to amend laws that unduly restrict rights and freedoms of Sri Lankans
byline: UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk has urged the Sri Lankan government to repeal or amend existing laws or proposed laws that unduly restrict the rights to freedom of opinion and expression, association, and peaceful assembly.

title: Sri Lanka needs human resource base with diverse vocational knowledge – PM
byline: Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the aim of the government is to strengthen the country’s economic stability by developing vocational education.

title: Mega-tsunami warning: Could a 1,000-foot tsunami hit the US Pacific Coast? Scientist raises alarm
byline: Scientists are warning of a potentially catastrophic mega-tsunami that could strike parts of the US Pacific Coast, triggered by a major earthquake along the Cascadia Subduction Zone.

title: President decides to temporarily halt Mannar Wind Power Project
byline: A decision has been taken to suspend the construction of two wind power plants following concerns raised by various stakeholders.

title: J-pop idol Kenshin Kamimura found guilty of indecent assault in Hong Kong
byline: J-pop star Kenshin Kamimura was found guilty by a Hong Kong court on Wednesday of the indecent assault in March of a woman who served as his interpreter during a fan event.

title: Over 7,000 T-56 ammunition recovered from Getalawa tank
byline: Authorities have recovered another cache of live T-56 ammunition, following a special search operation carried out after the initial discovery of ammunition in an irrigation tank in Getalawa, Galenbindunuwewa.

title: Body of male found floating in Bolgoda River
byline: A body of a male has been discovered floating in the Bolgoda River, near the Kospalana Bridge along the Piliyandala–Moratuwa road, police stated.

title: S&P Global upgrades India Sovereign Ratings to ‘BBB’ From ‘BBB-’
byline: S&P Global said on Thursday that it has raised India’s sovereign rating to BBB from the previous ‘BBB-’.

title: More than 35 dead in flash floods on popular pilgrimage route in Himalayas
byline: At least 38 people have died after flash floods hit a village hosting Hindu pilgrims in Indian-administered Kashmir.

title: How can Sri Lanka improve its position in the Global Innovation Index?
byline: A meeting was held to engage all stakeholders in elevating Sri Lanka’s position in the internationally recognised Global Innovation Index, which measures countries’ innovation performance using 80 indicators under seven key pillars.

title: Acting Director of Police Cultural Division arrested on bribery charges remanded
byline: The Acting Director of the Police Cultural Division, SSP Sathish Gamage, who was arrested by the Bribery Commission earlier today (14), has been remanded, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Sri Lanka targets 4–5% GDP growth in medium to long-term: CBSL Governor
byline: Sri Lanka is striving to achieve 4–5% GDP growth in the medium to long-term in comparison to the baseline requirement of 3% set by the IMF to achieve debt sustainability, Governor of the Central Bank Nandalal Weerasinghe has stated.

title: ‘Aswesuma’ welfare benefit allowances to be credited tomorrow
byline: The Welfare Benefits Board has announced that the “Aswesuma” welfare benefit allowances for the month of August will be credited to the beneficiary bank accounts tomorrow (15).

title: Igor Babuschkin, co-founder of Elon Musk’s AI startup, xAI resigns
byline: Igor Babuschkin, a co-founder of Elon Musk’s xAI startup, announced his departure from the company on Wednesday in a post on X.

title: Probe launched after urea fertilizer poured into SLTB bus engine in N’Eliya
byline: An investigation has been launched by the Nuwara Eliya Police regarding an incident where urea fertilizer was poured into the engine of a bus belonging to the Nuwara Eliya Sri Lanka Transport Board depot.

title: 400 containers of imported salt stuck at Colombo Harbour due to bureaucratic delays: Unions
byline: Approximately 400 containers containing around 28,000 metric tons of imported salt, intended for local packaging, remain stuck at the Colombo Harbour, unable to be cleared, according to the Sri Lanka Salt Producers’ Association.

title: COPF approves Gambling Regulatory Authority Bill
byline: The Bill to establish the Gambling Regulatory Authority has been approved by the Committee on Public Finance.

title: Pakistan to create military force to supervise missiles after India conflict
byline: Pakistan will create a new force in the military to supervise missile combat capabilities in a conventional conflict, apparently a move to match neighbouring arch-rival India.

title: At least 12 feared dead in sudden, heavy rain in Indian Kashmir
byline: At least 12 people were feared dead and more trapped following sudden, heavy rain in Indian Kashmir, an official said on Thursday.

title: 30 Sri Lankan students receive Chinese govt scholarships
byline: A total of 30 Sri Lankan students have received scholarships to undertake higher education in China.
